Package farkleapp

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • farkleapp.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    The Model class interfaces with Controller and FarkleDiceLogic to map the numerical logic done on our dice to a visual representation usable by our JavaFX controller.
    Version:
    1.9

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Model​()
      Just defining a default constructor for use by child classes.
      Model​(FarkleControllerInterface controller)
      Constructor that adds all the Dice images to an arrayList and maps them to integers from 1-6, as well as obtains the rectangle of javafx objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void animateView​()
      Animates the dice with our images in the view.
      void checkRolled​()
      This method checks to see if we have rolled or not yet for the first time since the game start.
      int getBankScore​()
      This method calls a logic method that tallies up and returns the current bank score.
      int getEstRoundScore​()
      Gets the amount of points you have with held dice.
      int getFarkleCount​()
      This accesses the number of farkles in our current round.
      java.util.ArrayList<Dice> getHand​()
      Gets hand.
      void getHandFill​(java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> rect)
      This method sets the fill of our rList to the correct image based on if it's not held (if Dice are rolled again, then it will need to update the pictures).
      FarkleDiceLogic getLogic​()
      Returns the game's reference to FarkleDiceLogic.
      java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> getrList​()
      This method gets the list of rectangles.
      java.util.LinkedHashMap<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle,Dice> getrMap​()
      This gives the mapping of the current dice and rectangles.
      int getRollCount​()
      Returns the rollCount variable.
      int getRoundScore​()
      This method tallies up and returns the current round score.
      boolean isFarkle​(java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> list)
      This method checks our logic to see if we've Farkled.
      void mapDice​()
      This maps the current hand of rList to dice objects with values.
      void modHoldStatus​(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle r)
      This method determines what state the rectangle that was clicked was in.
      void resetHand​()
      This method calls logic.resetRound and sets all of the rList' effects to null (not held or clicked anymore).
      void setBankScore​()
      This method calls bankPoints in our logic instance of the FarkleDiceLogic class.
      void setHand​()
      This method takes the hand of Dice objects and rolls the values using the game instance of the FarkleDiceLogic class.
      void setRectFill​(javafx.scene.image.Image dnum)
      This method simultaneously sets the fill for each die within the ArrayList to a specific image.
      void setrList​(java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> rList)
      This sets all of the rectangles in A source View to the rectangles in RList.
      void setRollCount​(int count)
      Method for setting the variable that keeps track of how many rolls we've performed.
      void setRolled​()
      This method keeps track of how many times we've rolled the hand in a round.
      boolean wonGameStatus​()
      This is a pass-through for logic.wonGameStatus that determines if we've won the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model​(FarkleControllerInterface controller)
        Constructor that adds all the Dice images to an arrayList and maps them to integers from 1-6, as well as obtains the rectangle of javafx objects.
        Parameters:
        controller - that will be communicating with the model.

      • Model

        public Model​()
        Just defining a default constructor for use by child classes.

    • Method Detail

      • setRectFill

        public void setRectFill​(javafx.scene.image.Image dnum)
        This method simultaneously sets the fill for each die within the ArrayList to a specific image. It also checks if any of the Dice in the current hand are held, if so, it will skip over animating these rList.
        Parameters:
        dnum - the Image being passed that the rList will be set to.

      • animateView

        public void animateView​()
        Animates the dice with our images in the view.

      • mapDice

        public void mapDice​()
        This maps the current hand of rList to dice objects with values.

      • setHand

        public void setHand​()
        This method takes the hand of Dice objects and rolls the values using the game instance of the FarkleDiceLogic class.

      • getHandFill

        public void getHandFill​(java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> rect)
        This method sets the fill of our rList to the correct image based on if it's not held (if Dice are rolled again, then it will need to update the pictures).
        Parameters:
        rect - An ArrayList of Rectangles that will have their fill property updated.

      • modHoldStatus

        public void modHoldStatus​(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle r)
        This method determines what state the rectangle that was clicked was in.
        Parameters:
        r - the Rectangle being passed to check the hold status.

      • checkRolled

        public void checkRolled​()
        This method checks to see if we have rolled or not yet for the first time since the game start. If it has, then you are not allowed to un-hold a dice, and it prompts with an alert.

      • isFarkle

        public boolean isFarkle​(java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> list)
        This method checks our logic to see if we've Farkled. If we do, it alerts view.
        Parameters:
        list - is the hand being checked for farkle.
        Returns:
        the boolean representing whether or not we Farkle.

      • setRolled

        public void setRolled​()
        This method keeps track of how many times we've rolled the hand in a round.

      • setBankScore

        public void setBankScore​()
        This method calls bankPoints in our logic instance of the FarkleDiceLogic class.

      • getBankScore

        public int getBankScore​()
        This method calls a logic method that tallies up and returns the current bank score.
        Returns:
        the Integer value representing the bank score.

      • resetHand

        public void resetHand​()
        This method calls logic.resetRound and sets all of the rList' effects to null (not held or clicked anymore).

      • getRoundScore

        public int getRoundScore​()
        This method tallies up and returns the current round score.
        Returns:
        the Integer value representing the current score of your hand.

      • getEstRoundScore

        public int getEstRoundScore​()
        Gets the amount of points you have with held dice.
        Returns:
        the estimated round score.

      • wonGameStatus

        public boolean wonGameStatus​()
        This is a pass-through for logic.wonGameStatus that determines if we've won the game.
        Returns:
        yes or no if we've won the game.

      • getFarkleCount

        public int getFarkleCount​()
        This accesses the number of farkles in our current round.
        Returns:
        The number of farkles in the current round.

      • setRollCount

        public void setRollCount​(int count)
        Method for setting the variable that keeps track of how many rolls we've performed.
        Parameters:
        count - the variable that will pass on how many rolls we have.

      • getRollCount

        public int getRollCount​()
        Returns the rollCount variable.
        Returns:
        The count of our rolls.

      • getrMap

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle,Dice> getrMap​()
        This gives the mapping of the current dice and rectangles.
        Returns:
        Linked Hash Map that contains the above.

      • getHand

        public java.util.ArrayList<Dice> getHand​()
        Gets hand.
        Returns:
        current array list representing the hand of dice

      • getrList

        public java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> getrList​()
        This method gets the list of rectangles.
        Returns:
        The list of current JavaFX rectangles.

      • setrList

        public void setrList​(java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> rList)
        This sets all of the rectangles in A source View to the rectangles in RList.
        Parameters:
        rList - the array list of javafx rectangles for the model to manipulate.

      • getLogic

        public FarkleDiceLogic getLogic​()
        Returns the game's reference to FarkleDiceLogic.
        Returns:
        logic
